contextId.information: Here "hand" stands for acting or doing. AT: "through the action of Malachi" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This name "Esau" refers here not only to Esau, but also to all his descendants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Edom" stands for the people of Edom. AT: "If the people of Edom say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "my name" stands for Yahweh himself. AT: "treat me as though you hate me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "face" stands for God and also for his presence. AT: "keep asking God in his presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: keep asking the face of God

contextId.information: Here "hand" stands for the people bringing the offering. AT: "brought by you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here this expression refers to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here finding something stands for that thing existing. AT: "there was no falsehood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here turning toward a gift stands for receiving it and showing favor to the giver. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: does not turn toward the offering

contextId.information: Here "hand" stands for the person giving the offering. AT: "from you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Judah" and "Jerusalem" stand for the people in those places. AT: "the offerings brought by the people of Judah and Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the offering of Judah and Jerusalem

contextId.information: Here "all Israel" is a reference to all the people in the nation of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
